meanings.definition: Greenlights: signals on a traffic light that indicate it is safe to proceed
meanings.sent1: At the intersection, I waited for the greenlights before crossing the street.
meanings.sent2: When the greenlights turned on, the cars started moving smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The greenlights were like little colorful beacons guiding us through the busy traffic.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the greenlights that brightened up his day.
meanings.sent5: The greenlights blinked cheerfully, giving the go-ahead to all the drivers.

meanings.definition: Greenlights: approval or permission to move forward with a project or plan
meanings.sent1: Getting the greenlights from the boss made me feel confident about my idea.
meanings.sent2: After receiving the greenlights, we can start working on the new project.
meanings.sent3: His enthusiastic thumbs-up was the greenlights we needed to kick off the event.
meanings.sent4: The greenlights from the committee were like a stamp of success on our proposal.
meanings.sent5: With the greenlights in hand, we were ready to take the next big step in our plan.
